SEARCH
Package danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing

Class KeyboardMovementDirector

java.lang.Object
danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing.MovementDirector
danogl.components.movement_schemes.movement_directing.KeyboardMovementDirector
public class KeyboardMovementDirector extends MovementDirector
A MovementDirector that responds to keyboard input. In the context of this MovementDirector it is important to distinguish between input functions such as "up" or "jump", to their assigned keys. An instance of this class is already constructed with limited builtin input functions. The keys for these can be altered, and additional input functions (with their keys) can be added.
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Method Details

    • setKeyboardKey

      public void setKeyboardKey(String function, int keyFromKeyEvent)
      Assign a key to a given input function.
      Parameters:
      function - A string representing the input function. If this function already had a key mapped to it, it is replaced by the new key.
      keyFromKeyEvent - An int constant from the class KeyEvent to assign to the given function

    • inputPredicateOfKey

      public BooleanSupplier inputPredicateOfKey(int keyfromKeyEvent)
      Create a predicate of a given keyboard-key
      Parameters:
      keyfromKeyEvent - one of the constants from KeyEvent
      Returns:
      a BooleanSupplier that returns true iff the given key is pressed
